newsitem.title: CANADA: Greyhound Air to use travel agencies.
newsitem.headline: Greyhound Air to use travel agencies.

text.p: Greyhound Canada Transportation Corp said on Tuesday it would change a major tenet of its year-old discount air service by offering tickets through travel agencies.
Greyhound Air said it would phase in the sale of seats through agencies starting with Thomas Cook/Marlin Travel and Carlson Wagonlit, effective immediately.
The company said it was responding to customer requests to allow the booking of air travel, hotel rooms and car rentals on the same telephone call.
Until now, tickets on Greyhound's no-frills air service have been sold only though the Calgary-based transport firm's own network.
